Replies.Reply: Written by  Joel Hopkins    Sound of a piano being played. Sparse but beautiful.
I know, but I want to hear it. Put it up.
Johnnie, you were the one that was late. Just put it up.
Yeah, I'm heading there now. What's going on?
Johnnie said something about you wanting him to present on Monday.
No, I'm coming back. Those are my connections. They have been for years.
I want to come back. I should be there in person.
I have to stand behind my music!
You got me doing triangle chimes for Christ's sake - give me something to compose!
I'm back on Monday, Marvin. I'm coming back.
Miss? I'm sorry. I've spilt my drink.
Thanks... And could I get another?
The Stewardess heads off. Harvey mops himself up. He places the small mass of wet towels on his tray and sighs. Glancing out the window, he then turns to the woman.
She's marrying an American. But for some reason we've all got to go over to London.
I told her we had a perfectly good wedding system here.
They both work there, you see.
I'm sorry, but I'm in a bit of a hurry.
Look, I'm sorry, but I'm tired, you know?
Hi Suzie, it's your Dad. I've made it in one piece. I'm in a Taxi on my way to the Hotel. I guess i'll see you all there. Can't wait. Love you.
Hi, it's Harvey, Harvey Shine here.
Hi. I'm with the wedding party.
Good. Has everyone else checked in?
My daughter. Susan Shine. Or maybe she's already going by Wright.
Do you have a Mrs Pearce?
Suzie! Hi darling. Yes, I'm here.
No its...fine. I just wasn't sure.
So your mother has rented a house for you all.
I see. No, no, don't be silly. I'm a big boy. It's fine.
Yes, I've got the address. So, I'll see you there.
Just over by the bed. Thank you.
No, no, that's not right. I booked Mike. It's important. I spoke to him about it two weeks ago. I booked him.
Have you told him its Harvey. It's really important...
Just...Just get him to call me, Ok?
Replies.Didascalie: (CONT'D) (suddenly conscious of Scott's friends standing nearby)

Replies.Reply: I work in the music industry.
Oh, you know, for...commercials, that sort of thing. TV.
Mostly background stuff, that sort of thing.
Well, I'm sure that's pretty profitable too.
Well, I'd better find my daughter.
Give us a hug then, as they say in this country.
I spilt something on my trousers.
I've been doing that a lot recently.
Long way to come to see two American kids get married.
I'll speak to you later Suz. You enjoy your friends.
So our baby girl is really getting married. Who would've thought?
Of course I do. Hell, its been a while. I guess, not since Jean and I split up.
Thank you, Jill. You're looking well too. Both of you. I guess you guys stayed in touch with Jean.
Sorry, I have to take this.
It'll take two hours max. No longer.
Have you told him its Harvey? Look, we go back! He'll tell you. Just have him call me.
Sorry, I thought it was off.

Replies.Didascalie: (CONT'D) (flustered he finally manages to stop it buzzing)

Replies.Reply: To Susan and Scott. A great couple.
Why, Jean? Are you worried i'm going to embarrass you again?
Oh, you're good Jean. You're really good. You've always known how to make me feel shit, haven't you?
You've always been so good at that.
Tell me, Jean. Were you ever proud of me?
The parties Jean. The fuckin' parties, where I would hear you -
What is it you see in Brian?
Yeah. I'm great. How are you doing?
He seems a good guy, Scott. You'll be alright.
Well, not great, but...fine. You know the usual. Triangle chimes.
Listen Suz, I'm really sorry about having to leave early. It's just bad timing. There's a sudden rush at work, you know, a couple of big jobs in at once.
It just can't be helped. But I'll be there at the ceremony, at the really important bit. I'll be there to give you away.
And then I'm sure Brian or your mother will talk at the reception.
It's work darling. It pays for things.
You go and be with your friends. Go and enjoy yourself.
I gotta make some stupid calls. You know. Go and enjoy yourself, Sweetheart. I'll see you tomorrow.
Is there another way we could try?
Just hand luggage, can i go straight to the gate?
Please. I've gotta make that flight.
But it's not yet 4! I just have hand luggage. It doesn't take off for another 40 minutes.
But I just have hand luggage.
Marvin. It's Harvey. Listen, there's been a mess up, the traffic was crazy. I'm going to have to reschedule the pitch slightly.
The traffic was insane. But listen...
It's fine, I'll be there lunch-
Letting me go? Can't afford the space? Marvin, I'll be there lunch-
I know, we don't raise our voices in this country. It's not done.
For yesterday. I was rude. You tried to ask me some questions.
You were just trying to do your job and I was rude.
I reckon it'll help as much as that trashy novel and a glass of chardonnay.
I'm really sorry. That was out of line.
It's just that i've had a really shitty day.
No. I mean really shitty. Yours may have been shitty, but mine was shittier.
I missed my flight. I lost my job.
Let me make it up to you.
Would you let me buy you lunch.
Exactly. That's why we should have lunch - tea.
Because you've got your book. And it's a good replacement for humans.
If that's for me I'm in the shower.
Aren't you going to answer that?
Should I take that as a hopeful sign.
Look we are having lunch together.
Ah, that's better. I knew something was missing.
I had to get back for a work thing.
No. Not really. They've beaten it out of me. But its what i do - did.
Well, maybe, I mean it maybe before your time.
You can take the Salem out of the country - but you can't take the country out of Salem.
No, I just love the way you...you just cut through it.
I was going to be a Jazz pianist.
No. I like it. I like it...
It's a relief to find someone in this country who actually says what they feel.
Just as we're trying to adopt your stiff upper lip.
What is a stiff upper lip, exactly?
I don't know. I guess I'll stay in a Hotel near here. My flight's in the morning.
I thought i might as well stay in town. More fun than a hotel next to a runway, right?
Yours is a beautiful city, Kate.
I'm afraid I'm not much of a reader.
Both our phones ring a lot. We have that in common.
And what would you do there?
Ok. So this house in Spain would have a little cabana looking out over the plains for you to write in.
And a little stream running by, to bathe in.
Sorry, that's if you're receiving guests.
Somewhere along the way I lost her.
I'd always had this mean little feeling in my stomach, that they were a bit embarrassed by me.
If you saw them now, with Brian, Susan's step-father. You'd see, they make more sense. They look right together.
I've not been a great father.
Only if you come with me.
Please, come with me. As my...bodyguard.
We'll find you a dress. If we find you a dress, will you come?
You get back. Don't worry about us, we'll find a place.
You're not Miriam's kid are you?
Wow...You've...got big. I mean grown up.
But you see I can't just sit hear and watch somebody else give my baby girl away. Susan's my daughter and I'm her father. Not the best, by far, but her father all the same.
Um... I should have prepared something but... I guess it reminds me of a joke...
No Jean. I want to make a scene.
I wanna tell Scott, how damn lucky he is!
And also if he ever hurts her, I know people in north of London.
Seriously though. Scott, I swear you have found in Susan a bright and passionate person. And a loyal friend.
And I can see from the way she looks at you. From the way she is with you, that she is...
And I thank you and welcome you to the family.
And finally, if I can linger a moment longer. I would like to turn it back over to Brian, with a note of... gratitude.
Thank you for being there for my baby girl. Thank you for being there, when I wasn't.
But, you know, maybe I want to be with you.
Hey kid, they're playing our song.
Come on. I want you to meet people.
You wanna get out of here?
Exactly here, at these chairs. At noon.
I know enough to know, I'll be here. Waiting, at this chair.
Can I have something until tomorrow.
I've got to go. I've got to be somewhere.
Yes, S.V.T'S, that's what I've been trying to tell the nurse. I've had it since I was a kid. I take Primax. I guess i've been forgetting to take it recently.
I know it's Arrhythmia! Please, I have to be there.
It's some sort of Statistics Agency.
Yes. That sounds right. Yes, based out at Heathrow.
Miss, could I borrow, your pen.
Oh, I'm still in London, Marvin.
Heathrow please. As quick as you can.
Excuse me, I'm looking for a Kate.
Kate, I just wanted to apologise and explain...
I had to go to Hospital.
No, it's nothing, I'm fine, I just forgot to take my pills. I have this condition, I've had it since I was a kid - it's an irregular heart-
Yes! How do you know what it is?
Well, young men get it too.
Kate, I want this. I want you.
Should I take that as a hopeful sign?
If you just give me a little wider smile.
I think you're my kinda girl.
Why don't you ask me those questions?
You know, from the airport. When I wouldn't stop.
They don't want to hear it, Harvey.
Listen, Harvey. Marvin wants me to present my ideas while your away.
Look, I'm not doing myself any favours here, Harvey. But, I'd watch your back.
Hey, Harvey. Shouldn't you be in London?
Oh yeah, No, I was just thinking that, what with you being in London - you should stay a while.
There's no need to rush back. Enjoy your daughter's wedding.
Well, Johnnie can do it. I mean, he can pitch the Samuelson account.
I know but... they've got new people running things over there. I think they're after something...
They're demos! - They're already pressed. No one needs to be there.
That's what I'm trying to tell you!
You got to land this one, Harvey.
I'm saying there are no more chances, Harvey.
Hey Harvey, it's Marvin. Where are you?
Well you get yourself back here my friend. I've got some great news.
look, I know when to eat humble pie. So look, hey, when can you get back here?
What you mean you quit? Harvey, fuck you man, you need us.
I'm really sorry but I have a meeting in the morning and I must try and get some sleep.
It's just, I'll be useless - unless I get some sleep.
Morning Kate. Looking lovely as ever. If I was younger...
So maybe Polish people like to barbecue a lot. I'm leaving your prescription on the table.
Replies.Didascalie: (pulling a small package from her bag)

Replies.Reply: You know, you don't have to keep taking these - the Doctor said.
I've got to go. I'll call you later.
Was that from his terrace in the South of France?
Only if you guys swear you won't leave if it's not going well.
So you spent the whole 2 weeks in the Toronto area?
So not a business trip then?
Sorry, I couldn't just ask you a few very quick questions, could I?
They're completely in again, haven't you heard?
Ok, mum. Thanks for the advice.
Ok, Let's talk about it later.
She's worrying about her new neighbour. Says he barbecues a lot.
Nice like how old is he?
He can't be, he's looks like a baby.
Oh right. Did Matt offer that up -
I have to. She's on her own.
Mum. You've got to stop calling.
What? I can't hear. Hold on.
We don't really. We just met.
I don't really remember, but I'm sure you were. Most people are.
It probably would be, if i could finish it.
What? Go away and stop apologizing.
But what can I do for you?
That's very sweet of you, but... I don't know you. And... you don't know me.
If it is, you could just give me a little wider smile.
No. We're having lunch next to each other.
So why aren't you at the wedding?
A work thing. For the job you just lost?
So, this job you lost. You liked it?
Did you always want to write jingles or was there something more?
I'll take that as a compliment.
I'm sorry, I can be nosey. I tend to blurt stuff out.
That's all changed. We're a nation changed. Ever since Diana, we've unlocked ourselves. Everything's flowing out.
You guys showed us the way.
No, I think, it's more this.
Yeah you're getting there. Stretch it out further.
No, now you're doing a bulldog.
No, now you look like you don't have any teeth.
My dad had a front one that you could just take out.
I should get going. I have a class.
Twice a week. Just something I do.
I take the Heathrow Express. What about you?
Taxi's are over there. They'll take you to wherever you need to go.
So, I guess it's goodbye again.
Its just a funny way of saying it.
No, we're just quite different, that's all.
Sorry. I should probably take this.
No, I'm out. Yes with someone. No someone else.
Mum. Listen. I'll come over tomorrow and we can check it out together.
I have to go now. Just get an early night and i'll see you tomorrow.
She's convinced she's living next to Poland's answer to Ted Bundy.
She means well. She's just had a tough run.
My Father ran off to France with his secretary. Then mum got cancer, about four years ago now. She's fully recovered. But won't admit it.
Yes, my rotting eggs are her raison d'Ãªtre.
Well, here we are. My class.
It's getting cold. You don't want to wait.
Careful, I might get the wrong impression.
Lovely mild-mannered Mike read us the latest installment from his Physcho-Sexual Thriller, and we all tried to look at him in the same way after.
Do you ever wish you could try a different life?
Just for a day. Just to see what it would be like.
Well, no green, that's for sure.
It would take place in Spain. A little house inland.
I think I've got one inside me.
Sure, you can visit Harvey Shine.
The reception. It's still going on?
What the hell are you doing here?
Stop feeling so sorry for yourself.
Harvey, it would be unforgivable not to go.
Harvey, firstly, i'm not about to go to anyone's wedding in a green polyester work suit. Secondly it's not right.
Now you're not to dominate the conversation tonight.
You should be with your family, Harvey.
I don't think I've stayed up all night since I was a student.
Oh, I don't know. My uniform's green?
I didn't have it. Didn't give it a moment's thought.
I do sometimes wonder what they'd be like today.
I don't know why i just told you that.
You say that now, but wait until tomorrow.
Harvey we know nothing about each other. You're...
I can be mean. Really mean.
Ok mum, that's me, I'm done.
I can't, I've got to go.
Not to pry or anything but why is there a large smoked ham under the stairs?
So probably not a mass murderer.
Of course I will. I'll be fine.
You're still here - still in London...
No, you don't have to - explain -
I don't need to hear - it's fine, seriously.
Harvey, I like you, I really do.

Exactly. And we're not teenagers, so - you know, monday morning and life kicks in, all that jobs and family and brown envelopes with bills in - it was a lovely day and I won't forget it, but it's not exactly real life...
But it's not just about you, is it?
You don't know anything about me.

And I am not going to do it, I'm not going to do it because it will hurt. Not right now, maybe, but soon - there will be a "it's not quite working is it" or a "I need some space" or whatever it is and it'll end and it'll hurt and I won't do it, I won't and...I...Oh fuck, I don't want to cry. I don't want this...
I think it's actually easier for me to be disappointed. I think I'm actually angry at you for trying to take that away.
Mum, I love you, but not now.
So how's this going to work, Mr Shine?
Have a cup of tea with me.
I like to. It makes me feel better.
Its 8 o'clock in the morning. Who barbecues at 8?
Of course. Don't worry about me.
Now don't be nervous. Just be yourself.
Oh, listen. I've been thinking about Greece for our holiday.
Why don't you stay and have some lunch?
Oh, that, yes...It's, um...The neighbour gave it to me.
Are you sure you're going to be alright?
Men, who needs them. Remember we've got Greece to look forward to.
Four across. A filmy layer on the surface of a liquid?
Are we still on for tonight? Matt's definitely bringing Simon.
Aggie, why do you bother? You just get Kate to give you all the answers.
I got you the same as me.
They're at the bar. He seems very nice.
Come on, i'm feeling small down here. Sit!
Nice? Nice like good. Or nice like dull.
Alright, my age. But Matt says he's very mature.
We've gotta go. Problem at home.
Kate it's for you. Some guy called Harvey.
Um, I'm sorry. She's not here.
She likes you. I can tell.
Now, don't you go messing her around. Don't you hurt her.
But you might find her at her class.
I think it starts around now. Down on the Southbank. At the National.
Well, go on. Go get her.
Yes. Our daughter lives there, see.
Oh, no. Unless you count grand-
Yes. I have a double room for you.
No, sir. No one of that name.
I'm afraid they're both out of order, Sir.
Yes. If you can call it work.
Looks like we've been set up.
No. It's not your fault. I mean, I'm fine with it. I mean, I'm happy to meet new people.
No, it's fine. What do you fancy?
Sorry, i bumped into these guys and couldn't shake them.
Kate this is Andrew, Melissa, Gwen, and Elinor.
England were all out by tea, when I last checked.
Shall I open this for you?
Can't wait to marry your daughter, really.
She's through there. She'll be thrilled you're here. I'll go and find her.
So without further ado, I'd like to propose a toast to Susan for making my friend Scott complete.
Absolutely. Good to meet you, Harvey. See you in there.
And now for the best man's speech.
And now ladies and Gentlemen. It is the turn of the Father of the Bride to say a few words.
Ladies and Gentlemen, the first dance.
Ladies and Gentlemen. The bride and groom are about to leave. Please join me outside to send them off in style.
Yes. They're over by our table.
Dad. I moved you. I thought it might be easier in case you needed to get out.
I'm sorry, I haven't had much time to talk to you.
Are you still doing your own stuff?
Brian has been a really big part of my life now for some time. And...
And I'm going to ask him to give me away tomorrow.
Dad, I've hardly seen you in the past five years.
Dad, it is. Maybe a quick coffee here, or a telephone call there but no, you haven't been part of my life. And...
You having to leave early this weekend. I don't know, it just seems typical.
I'm sorry Dad, but it's what I've decided.
Could you find them a seat please.
No, Harvey. I didn't touch it.
Can I get a glass of water please?
No Harvey, I'm worried you're going to embarrass yourself.
And more importantly Susan. This weekend's just about her and Scott.
Go home Harvey. Go to bed and see your daughter get married tomorrow.
For God's sake Harvey, don't make a scene.
Barry and I work together now.
Well I think we should sit. I know Susan wanted us all seated before they joined us.
Shall we have a quick toast to get things going?
I'm going to save my big speech for tomorrow.
Jean and I love you both so much.
Well, that's quite some speech Josh. Quite something to follow.
If you would all please join Harvey and I, in a toast.
Property, now. A small portfolio down in Florida.
Sorry, I hope we're not barging in on your evening.
It was Simon's idea. How do you guys know each other, anyway?
I see. I think we should leave you guys alone.
What? Men in white. Oh, I do.
Hey does anyone know the cricket score?
I heard that they did it in her bedroom, while she was away.
Yep. He has his own, but was basically living at hers.
It's going to be bad everywhere.
Hey pal, we're all in hurry.
Sir, I'm dealing with a passenger, you'll have to wait.
Sir, everyone is in a hurry. You'll just have to wait.
I'm afraid this is the only place left.
Sir, I need you to stay calm. It looks to me like Arrhythmia - an irregular heart-beat.
Well Ok, then we probably know where we're at. But I need to check all possibilities.
wouldn't be doing my job if I didn't check out absolutely everything.
Nurse, we'll do an EKG, followed by Bloods. And can you arranfe a monitored bed for him for tonight.
If I could just get you to sign these, you'll be all done.
The blood oozes from his wound like dark chocolate on a warm summer's day.
